== Main Inclusion Report for embryo ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/e/embryo/]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of netbook-launcher-efl required by the Mobile/ARM team.
** <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Specs/Mobile2DLauncher|Lucid Blueprint]]</nowiki>
0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=embryo|CVE entries]]</nowiki>:
** No entries for Embryo.
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=embryo|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/pkg/embryo.html|Ubuntu CVE's]]</nowiki>: none
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid, no daemons
** No known source code review
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Always works out of the box without configuration
** No debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:embryo|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: 
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=535774|Fail to build on Hurd]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=557503|Typo in package description]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=557504|Typo in package description]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/e/embryo.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is vigorous
** <nowiki>[[http://trac.enlightenment.org/e/wiki/Embryo|Upstream]]</nowiki> is vigorous
0. ''UI standards:''
** No user visible strings
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy 3.8.2]]</nowiki> compliant
0. ''Dependencies:''
** All dependencies satisfied in main.
0. ''Maintenance:''
** Ubuntu Mobile Team takes responsibility for package
** Ubuntu Mobile team will explicitly keep track of bugs on embryo and netbook-launcher-efl (where embryo regressions would most likely manifest themselves)
0. ''Background information:''
** This package is a dependency of netbook-launcher-efl which is to be packaged by the mobile team as part of an effort to bring the netbook experience to non-3d accelerated architectures on ARM.
